title: The sudden and unexplained death of Belarussian foreign minister Vladimir Makei
description: Vladimir Makei, 64, was a loyal supporter of Belarussian leader Alexander Lukashenko and had no known chronic illnesses.

title: Taiwanese President's party suffers a crushing defeat in local elections
description: The DPP lost the capital, Taipei, but Tsai Ing-wen remains at the head of the island against a backdrop of tension with Beijing.

title: China moves to curb rare, nationwide protests
description: Chinese security forces filled the streets of Beijing and Shanghai on Monday following online calls for another night of protests to demand political freedoms and an end to Covid lockdowns.

title: World Cup 2022: Constraints and wise choices have shaped a new French team
description: Arriving in Qatar without any guarantees, Les Bleus have qualified for the knockout stages before their third group match and Didier Deschamps has undoubtedly found his starting 11.

title: World Cup 2022: Brazil through to next round after 1-0 win over Switzerland
description: The Brazilians overcame the absence of their injured star Neymar to make it through to the next stage of the competition with a match to spare.

title: Guaranteed Mafia-free Italian restaurant opens in Paris
description: La Poesia uses produce supplied by the Italian association Libera Terra, which cultivates farmland confiscated from organized crime gangs.

title: Irish regulator fines Meta €265m over data breach
description: Details of more than half a billion users of Facebook, which has its European HQ in Dublin, were leaked on a hacking website.

title: Ukraine First Lady demands global response to rape as a war crime
description: Speaking at a sexual violence summit in London, Olena Zelenska said the 100 rape cases being investigated by Kyiv prosecutors were a mere fraction of the crimes committed.

title: Water 'mega-basins' stir up turmoil in western France
description: Five people have gone on trial in western France for taking part in protests against water storage projects they say amount to the 'privatization' of water and raise environmental and financial concerns.

title: On Twitter, Elon Musk finds comfort in his right-wing 'filter bubble'
description: The businessman's exchanges say a lot – at least as much as his own tweets – about the ultra-conservative environment in which he moves.

title: Eight civilians killed as 21-hour-long Somalia hotel siege ends
description: Al-Shabaab militants attacked a higly-guarded hotel of the country's capital on Sunday evening.

title: Shanghai Covid protests turn political
description: As elsewhere in China, a rally for people who died in a fire after becoming trapped in their locked down building turned into a protest against the country's zero Covid policy.

title: A Russian spy couple caught in the burbs: In Sweden, 'The Americans' plays out in real life
description: The couple arrived in Sweden at the end of the 1990s and are suspected of having passed on information about military technology.

title: The Cure rolls back the years at concert in northern France
description: On tour in Europe, with a stopover in Pas-de-Calais on November 27, Robert Smith's band defies the years and music trends.

title: Great Barrier Reef could be removed from World Heritage list
description: A report says Australia must do more to avoid the largest coral reef system being declared 'in danger' by UNESCO.

title: The bizarre behavior of Bolsonaro's most radical supporters
description: From praying outside army buildings to singing the national anthem in front of a tire, Lula's defeat of the far-right president has given rise to some strange demonstrations.

title: The unflinching gaze of Ukrainian drones in Bakhmut
description: On the outskirts of this Donbas town – which Russian forces have been trying to conquer for more than four months –  the 58th Ukrainian brigade's command center coordinates its operations through aerial intelligence.

title: 'We don't need tests but freedom': Demonstrations across China move beyond zero-Covid
description: Since Friday, tens of thousands of people have participated, despite the risks, in rallies unseen since the Tiananmen demonstrations in 1989.

title: Cocaine import network dismantled between France, Belgium, Spain and Dubai
description: Suspected of importing more than 2 tonnes of cocaine into Europe between January and April 2021, the network was run by two Moroccans and a Frenchman from Dubai.

title: Olivier Faure: 'Environmental socialism is the answer to major problems'
description: The Parti Socialiste's (PS) first secretary thinks that the pathological search for profit and the hyperconcentration of wealth into the hands of a few threaten social cohesion and is in contradiction with the idea of climate justice.

title: Gucci customers grew tired of Alessandro Michele's incessant exuberance
description: The Italian designer has announced he is stepping down as the Kering brand is underperforming compared its two rivals, LVMH and Hermès.

title: China blames 'forces with ulterior motives' for linking Urumqi fire to Covid curbs
description: Unprecedented demonstrations took place in a number of Chinese cities over the weekend, including Shanghai and Beijing.

title: Al-Shabab militants lay siege to hotel in Mogadishu
description: Gunmen stormed the Villa Rose on Sunday. Authorities say at least four people have died so far in the attack.

title: 'The city can be bad for our mental health'
description: Studying the impact of the urban environment on well-being is the mission of the [S]CITY agency. For its director and co-founder, neuroscientist Emma Vilarem, this is a major social issue at a time of rapid urbanization.

title: Qatar 2022: A World Cup of protests and politics
description: LGBTQ+ rights, a ban on alcohol, Palestinian symbols, repression in Iran, and so on. Rarely in the history of the World Cup, this the first in the Arab world, have political expressions taken over the major sports event.

title: 'Publishing isn't a crime': Media outlets call to end Julian Assange prosecution for disclosing secrets
description: Five international publications, including 'Le Monde', are publishing an open letter stating that the US government must stop prosecuting Wikileaks' publisher for 'Cablegate'.

title: In the chlordecone case, as no trial is expected, indignation grows in the French West Indies
description: The final decision to dismiss the case is expected at the end of December. The victims will probably appeal it. They filed a complaint for poisoning in 2006, due to the large-scale use of this toxic insecticide on banana plantations in Guadeloupe and Martinique.

title: Mexico: President López Obrador leads hundreds of thousands of people in pro-government march
description: Many participants in Mexico City on Sunday had been bused in from provinces across Mexico on trips organized by the ruling Morena party, unions, and social groups.

title: In Spain, Catalan separatists obtain the abolition of sedition offense
description: The Spanish parliament has approved the reform of the penal code to abolish the offense under which nine pro-independence leaders were convicted in 2019.
